title: Let me know if this was a justified Ban
body:

replies.body:
On January fifth, you appear to have received a two-week ban, which would have explicitly stated that it was your final warning before a perma ban. That ban ended on January 19th. Today, January 20th, you spent a full chat log insulting your teammate's performance. Some frustration would have probably been passable, but you insulted him enough times to reasonably call it harassment, and even if you don't agree with that interpretation, it's incredible to me that you'd engage in this behavior so soon after your final warning was given.

So yes, justified ban.

> [{quoted}](name=Jo0o,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=cWXjaEFq,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2019-01-20T15:08:40.375+0000)
>
> On January fifth, you appear to have received a two-week ban, which would have explicitly stated that it was your final warning before a perma ban. That ban ended on January 19th. Today, January 20th, you spent a full chat log insulting your teammate's performance. Some frustration would have probably been passable, but you insulted him enough times to reasonably call it harassment, and even if you don't agree with that interpretation, it's incredible to me that you'd engage in this behavior so soon after your final warning was given.
> 
> So yes, justified ban.

I see, I did figure that it was just some frustration to be honest, I only asked for ult every time it was applicable within game. At what point does it turn from frustration to harassment in your opinion within the chat log. Not trying to be a jerk just want to honestly know.

> [{quoted}](name=Jesus Steve,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=cWXjaEFq,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2019-01-20T15:16:39.299+0000)
>
> I see, I did figure that it was just some frustration to be honest, I only asked for ult every time it was applicable within game. At what point does it turn from frustration to harassment in your opinion within the chat log. Not trying to be a jerk just want to honestly know.

You were consistently targeting Shen and other members, pointing out their mistakes, bad CS and such. This is unnecessary, beacuse that won't make them play better. If anything, it will just frustrate your teammates even more. That's why it falls under the negative attitude category.

> [{quoted}](name=KDA Umbra,realm=EUW,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=cWXjaEFq,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2019-01-20T15:21:30.509+0000)
>
> You were consistently targeting Shen and other members, pointing out their mistakes, CS and such. This is unnecessary, beacuse that won't make them play better. If anything, it will just frustrate your teammates even more. That's why it falls under the negative attitude category.

I see and understand that, but does it realistically warrant a permanent ban in this case? or should it have taken at least two-three more cases like this?

> [{quoted}](name=Jesus Steve,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=cWXjaEFq,comment-id=0000000000000000,timestamp=2019-01-20T15:22:26.344+0000)
>
> I see and understand that, but does it realistically warrant a permanent ban in this case? or should it have taken at least two-three more cases like this?

Once you get off your 14-day suspension, your account is only **extremely **thin ice, meaning that even the smallest misconduct can warrant a permanent suspension.

> [{quoted}](name=KDA Umbra,realm=EUW,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=cWXjaEFq,comment-id=00000000000000000000,timestamp=2019-01-20T15:26:08.690+0000)
>
> Once you get off your 14-day suspension, your account is only **extremely **thin ice, meaning that even the smallest misconduct can warrant a permanent suspension.

I see, thank you for explaining that to me.

> [{quoted}](name=Jesus Steve,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=cWXjaEFq,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2019-01-20T15:16:39.299+0000)
>
> I see, I did figure that it was just some frustration to be honest, I only asked for ult every time it was applicable within game. At what point does it turn from frustration to harassment in your opinion within the chat log. Not trying to be a jerk just want to honestly know.

If you find yourself pointing out a particular teammate's mistakes more than once or twice per game, you are doing it too much.
It is stated somewhere in riot's either tos or sc that you should provide tips and point out stuff to your team only if asked to or given permission to continue doing it. I know it sounds harsh but you should also not type as much as you do, try to keep chat to a minimum especially when you already had a 14-day ban. And especially if your team is not talking much just do the same
You seemed to have given up ("ff 15," "go next"), and you spent the entire match shouting at the Shen. Some sort of punishment seems justified according to the behavior rules in place.

How is this even questionable to you? lol. this game twists souls.

Hint: flaming your own team always unsportsmanlike, even if Riot doesn't think so.  You don't control his champ, you control yours.

Honestly I think the perma-ban over chat is kinda overused... However, depending on what your previous warnings/suspensions are for, this could be a long-term problem so it is very likely that was the determining factor to be honest.
this game is very liberal and sjw so hurting feelings is banworthy.
